H0.text: A solar-powered calculator is a device that directly converts chemical energy into electrical energy.

H1.text: A wood‑burning stove directly converts chemical energy into electrical energy.

H2.text: A battery-powered flashlight directly converts chemical energy into electrical energy.

H3.text: A wind‑powered sailboat is a device that directly converts chemical energy into electrical energy.

A4.text: Thus, higher energy reactants are converted to lower energy products, and the free-energy difference is delivered to the external circuit as electrical energy.

A5.text: Batteries are designed so that the energetically favorable redox reaction can occur only when electrons move through the external part of the circuit.
